activities: Patient data is utilized for processing of the patient samples to provide a test result to the ordering medical practitioner.  Test results are transmitted in a secure fashion directly to the medical practitioner, e.g. through an FTP portal. Qualified Ariosa personnel may also discuss the patient's personal information directly with the patient's medical practitioner.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Organization, Customer, Clinical Trial Data.  In the vast majority of cases, the data is not manually processed.  However, in limited circumstances, data may be manually processed.
recoursemech: Any dispute, claim or controversy arising out of or relating to Safe Harbor-related disputes shall be determined by an independent recourse mechanism (IRM) consisting of arbitration before one arbitrator who has at least seven (7) years of experience in handling Safe Harbor-related disputes. The arbitration shall be administered by JAMS pursuant to the set of JAMS rules mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
